links_reviews_text: Lightweight yet does have some warmth. I liked this jacket.. did not love it. Cute and comfy though
Perfect for my trip to Kauai!

This was cute. The lacey pattern is subtle because it is underneath the outermost layer of the jacket. It didn't rain when I wore it so I can't speak to how waterproof it is, but it was nice for nights when it got chillier on vacation (60 degrees). The waistline rode up and that was kind of annoying. I always wore it with jumpsuits or dresses, but I can imagine it would keep bringing your shirt along with it when it rides up.

links_reviews_title: Cute jacket but waistband isn't great
links_reviews_text: This jacket is adorable, light, airy, and great for the gym. The only downfall is the waistband rides up with the jacket is zipped. I have a short torso and when the waistband would bunch up, the jacket would billow.

I've been looking for a white jacket to wear to the gym (or put on right after a workout) and this one ticks all the boxes! It's soft, fits true to size, and the lining is a knit pattern that shows through the sheer outer giving it a unique look. I like the long cuffs and waistband too. I might love it too much to return it!
This sweatshirt is so comfy! It definitely fits large, so no need to size up if you want an oversized look. Great for heading to yoga or just walking around on a chilly day.
Really nice color and flowy in the right places
Really nice color and ruffle details. Slightly cropped/boxy fit but not overly short.
This is a great "go to" tee. Fun and and super comfortable.
very boxy and short, hard to wear

I loved this dress - it’s so comfortable, simple and flattering. I was worried that it would hang off of me, but it hugged my curves and showed off my booty. I was hoping to wear this to brunch or on a date, but it didn’t pan out. Will definitely rent again!
Very fun and you can dress up or down. Loved the pockets and the material is great!

While I really wanted to love this as a casual day look, it was huge and By huge I mean I am a very average sized girl with a larger chest and ordered an XS and it still didn’t fit. The photo is deceiving.

I wore this dress to a casual party and it worked perfectly. I paired it with low black boots. If you wore heels or a fancier shoe you could 100% dress it up for any occasion. It was perfectly roomy in the body for me which I loved because it was comfy and worked to be casual. Sleeve length was perfect. The side which doesn’t have a sleeve was a little loose. If my bust was any smaller it would probably slip a little. I ended up buying it because I can imagine a lot of places and occasions where I could wear it!
I ordered a medium but it was very large, additionally, it was like sweatshirt material and didn't look very nice... or like something I'd want to wear to dinner in a warm place.

I wore this dress to a holiday party and received so many compliments. I am pregnant so was looking for something elegant, but not form fitting. This dress worked perfectly. I would order for another event in the future.
I enjoyed wearing this. Though it did expose the chest a bit more than I’d like because the sleeveless part hung a little low for me but I still loved this dress

Okay in full disclosure I do have a pretty string-bean like body, but I could not get this dress to stay up. Specifically the side that does not have a sleeve- it gapped near my armpit and made me nervous it would slide down. I think it would be beautiful on someone who maybe filled it out more.
I got this to wear "out", and it was a great piece for that. I personally wore it with my vegan leather leggings, but it wasn't too short to wear on it's own either.
I loved the idea of this dress, but the fit was weird and the pockets made it very boxy on the bottom of the dress.
super loose around my chest, but very comfortable!
This dress is a thick cotton material. I got it in a large and it was all the way to my knees, so I found the fit to look awkward. Not the right fit for me!
Dress up with heels or wear w flats...so cute! Like a big cozy sexy sweatshirt w pockets!

links_reviews_title: Works well if you’re a stick figure
links_reviews_text: Wanted these to work but the denim is unforgiving - the high waist and soft fabric accentuated every curve of my belly and hips. Sigh.
Warning, the pants run small.
These were a little too highwaisted for me. They went all the way up to my ribcage and I have a pretty long torso. They may have been better if I hadn't sized up. I usually wear a 26.

The denim of these pants is soft and comfortable. They fit for the most part but were a little more snug in the hips and thighs than I would've liked. They loosened up a little after the first couple times I wore them. Next time I'll just order a size up. These are srsly high waisted! If you are on the fence about whether you like that style or not, try a more subtle high waist first. Also probably not a great pick for women who are petite. I'm 5'8" and still needed to wear them with a bit of a heel.
Everything fit and felt great - except in the waist. Might try this style again if my post-baby waist shrinks... but probably not!
I am 5'7' and these jeans were another foot.
Wow these are really long in the legs, I had to wear my highest heels. Narrow in the hips, when you sat down it made creases that would last all day. SUPER high waist.

The waist was way too high. It almost reached my bra! I also didn’t like that the jeans did not have front pockets. I wore the jeans with a sweater that covered up the high waist. The wide legs were fine & didn’t drag when the waist & crouch of the jeans were in the proper position. Glad I tried a couple of pairs of high waisted jeans. Did not like.

links_reviews_title: TALL GIRLS - THIS IS LIFE. THIS IS LOVE.
links_reviews_text: Unreal. Perfect fit. Finally the length I need. And the rise I need. Perfection all around

Unless you’re built like a supermodel or a giraffe these pants will not fit. The leg length and the “high waist” are ridiculously high and long. For the average size gal, these pants are way too long and the high waist is up to the ribs and literally under the breasts. I couldn’t help but laugh when I attempted to put these on. Honestly, Nuuly should take these pants out of rotation. The cut and size are the worst and are strictly for someone who happens to be 6 feet tall and has the longest torso ever. I feel like I wasted a rental period with these pants.

These jeans were super cute, but as a gal with a short torso they were cutting into my ribs. Also, the waist is super tight so don't expect a lot of give in that area if you need it. I would recommend these for people with longer torsos.

These jeans are the softest and the comfiest. Normally sitting down in high-waisted jeans can be tough but these do not dig in. They are much higher waisted than other high waisted bottoms I own. I have a short upper torso and the pants fit above my waist.

I have a really short torso, and my legs aren't very long... So these didn't look the cutest on me. I couldn't wear them, even with my tallest shoes. They fit perfect around my waist, and I loved the fit on my thighs. The denim is thin, soft and cool and I really dig the wash. But let's leave these for the "Legs for Days" girls out there!

links_reviews_title: Only if you are a tall, high waist die hard..
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to love these, the fabric was so soft and with clogs, heels, or boots the length was great for me and I'm 5'10". BUT the waist is INSANELY high - I'm talking like an inch below my boobs and I'm pretty small chested. It actually looked good but felt just like too much fabric around my midsection. If you love vintage high waists and are at least 5'9" or have serious heels, then you'll probably like these!

links_reviews_title: Should have read the reviews.. WAY too long
links_reviews_text: Yes, I am short, but these jeans were probably 10 inches too long! Couldn't wear them.

These fit me perfect but the waist literally went up to under my boobs yet still hit the ground/went past my feet. Honestly, they’re cute but the fit is very strange.. I don’t know if I’d really ever care to wear them
Cute style, just way too long for me and I'm 5'9". Didn't get to wear them :(

links_reviews_title: Amazing fit, but too long for me
links_reviews_text: These are the most perfectly super high-waisted jeans I’ve ever tried! If I owned them I would have to hem them though, they’re about a 32” length which I didn’t realize when I ordered them. Unfortunately I only have one pair of shoes tall enough to wear them with so they don’t drag and they’re not work or walking-in-new orleans friendly. Very soft denim, very comfortable waist (hit at the bottom of my ribcage), and VERY flattering. Short girls be aware of the length though! Still worth a try if you’ve got shoes tall enough for them.

links_reviews_title: good jeans, not a great fit for me.
links_reviews_text: These pants are really great. However, the denim fabric was thinner than I expected so not very slimming for a jean. More loose fitted than I would have hoped. They're really cute just not for me. I wonder if I sized down if they'd be better?

Wow, they weren't kidding when they said these have a high waist! The waist band came right up to my bust and considering they enclosed my entire ribcage, there was no way I was getting them zipped up. Then the inseam was incredibly too long - the cuffs would still drag with platform heels or wedges. The material was nice though.

Fit well in waist but found them to be too long for me. I did not wear but would consider giving them a second chance in the spring/summer time with high heeled wedges.

I wanted these pants to work so badly. They are beautiful; the colors and material are soft and flirty but they are long. I couldn’t wear them with my 1’ wedges because they were still too long (by 2 ish inches).

I loved these pants! They are a wider leg than they appear, so I couldn’t really get away with them at work like I thought I could. But, they are incredibly comfortable, light, beautiful, and trendy. I wore them with a plain white tee to run some errands, then with a white silky tank for brunch. Very versatile and luxurious.
Loved these! They’re super comfy and cute and can be paired with tons of different colors/types of tops. I wore them for work but they can be dressed up or down. Great item!

links_reviews_title: Effortlessly chic with legs for days
links_reviews_text: I'm obsessed with these pants! I wore them at my waist with a bodysuit and heels, as they were super long. I expected them to be long bc of my height, but couldn't wear anything less than a 4-inch heel, which was fine by me because it made my legs look long. Due to the length and flowy-ness I had to be a bit careful not to step on the bottom as I almost tripped at one point while hurrying to catch a train (the pants were maybe a centimeter or two from the ground so not dragging). I wasn't overly cognizant of this while out at dinner and a low-key bar but I definitely wouldn't wear to a super crowded place because people would step on it. The waist fit well - I probably could've sized down and dealt with some waist snugness to lessen the length because they are so flowy all over. For reference my waist is 25-26 inches and hips are 34 inches.
Very cute but the length is too long for flat shoes with my height (kept tripping!) elastic waist is pretty tight without the drawstring. Pockets are great!
I love these pants! They're so comfortable, and perfect for work. I'm really tall so they were a great length to wear with flat sandals.
Fits as expected
Love this top! Fit great and looked good with a ton!

links_reviews_title: Cute buttondown, but a bit boring
links_reviews_text: Nice, basic button down. The material is very breathable and the cut is interesting enough. But the color just didn't wow me.

links_reviews_title: Simple But Great for the Office
links_reviews_text: This worked great with black jeans for work. Easy to style, didn't wrinkle, and felt professional.
This is a fine shirt, absolutely nothing special. I feel like there are so many more interesting shirts on here, it would be better to try something unique!

I rented a size smaller since I saw the top ran a little big and it fit perfect. The material is so soft and breathable and in Miami weather that’s just what I need. The color is also such a pretty shade, overall I was so comfortable in this top.
I love this piece! My only complaint was the wear and tear. Slightly noticeable pilling and staining in the armpits. But I love the cut, and would absolutely purchase if it were in better condition.
Not the most exciting top and the color is a little bland/washed me out. It's cute if you need a very basic button down, but it's nothing special
Love this classic look! Great shirt. Perfect to pair with jeans. Great for work or going out.
Great basic shirt.
Boxy cut - not flattering

links_reviews_title: Wish I got a smaller size, but LOVE this shirt
links_reviews_text: Basic and great. Love this shirt.

A nice shirt! It was pretty boxy and wide, but was a cute button down. I think I tucked just the front in. It was too much fabric to tuck it all in like the model pic. Not the biggest fan of the color but it was nice to have something different!

links_reviews_title: Medium weight t-shirt that was perfect for my casual office.
links_reviews_text: Great with black jeans

I loved this little button down. Was incredibly flattering and I got a lot of use out of it. The collar is a little taller than I’m used to, but I think it made it look more polished. Fabric was a little itchy when I first put it on but it softened throughout the first wear and was comfortable otherwise.
Super cute, wore it to work a couple of times. Definitely need to iron before wearing it but it’s such a cute top!

So, as most of us know, pant sizes are all over the place. For me, a 30 in Levi’s is damn near perfect. I’m usually around a 28-29 in madewell jeans. I got a 30 in these, thinking I was erring on the large side- could barely get these on! Why do pant companies conspire to make us feel like this? Order up a size or two to be safe.
So cute and comfortable, wore these all the time to be cozy

I have 5'5 if that helps anyone, but it fit perfect everywhere else

So this dress is so cute - I love the pattern, the style, and the soft fabric. It definitely was on the small side even in a large it was a little tight on me (I'm typically between an 8 or a 10). I'm also 5'5" and this dress was insanely short. I really wanted to wear it but just couldn't find an opportunity for it.

I was wary about renting this after reading the reviews. This dress fits more like a long cami tunic. It’s too short and tight to wear out, and the ruffled straps were folded in on themselves and fading. Looked worn out really quickly
Too short and small

This dress was so cute and so flattering! The only thing is that I could tell it had been worn a lot because the fabric looked like it had been worn/washed many times (and not in a cute way). I definitely would have bought it if it looked new!

The material surprised me, from the photos I had the idea the dress would be of a thicker material but it was very thin and flowy. I won’t be able to wear this dress out due to how short it was. Bending over is completely out of the question but I’m going to try to wear it as a top to make the most of it. I would suggest sizing up!
I couldn’t really find a good place to wear this, it was super short and made me definitely look curvy which was cute. But it was super tight and honestly just felt kind of chubby in it

I absolutely loved this dress and got so many compliments. Many people told me the dress looked very Reformation like. I also loved it because it was super versatile. I wore it to work with a cute turtleneck and tights under it and I also wore it out at night with a leather jacket. The material was super soft and I loved that I was able to wear it without a bra!! My only small complaints would be that because the material was so soft it did look a bit worn in. The straps were also a bit stretchy so even though I wore it without a bra, I felt like I needed to pull it up sometimes. Overall, this dress is supppperr cute and I think if I were to rent again I would probably buy it. Def would recommend.

This was such an easy dress to throw on and feel cute in. It dressed up well for dinner with suede heeled boots and a jacket, but also was so cute in sandals at the beach. You don’t really need a bra in it and it’s stretchy and comfortable. It is very short though so as a longer-leg girl it was a little much when I even slightly bent over.
Super cute but runs really small. Wish I sized up!
I'm very tall (5'11) and this was way to short on me.

links_reviews_title: Its really cute, but it's really short.

Very cute dress. Light material. As other reviewers stated, it was way too small. Maybe even two sizes too small.
Super cute dress- I would say it does run a little small so be aware of that. Definitely a little on the short side as well...so I would say order a size up if you are in between sizes for comfort.

I really liked this though it may not fit a bigger bust

This dress was great! The bust area was a little tight for me, I would say that this may not work for anyone with larger than a B cup. Other than that I really enjoyed this dress, the fabric is thicker but the straps make it work for warmer weather too, overall a great dress for the transition from summer into fall.
Didn’t realize the straps were ties..they were sort of big. Very breasty 😂 I had a small amount of side boob, but I’m pretty small. Larger cup sizes be prepared
This was really cute and you tie the straps so it's adjustable. Really comfortable -- could wear day into night!
This was super cute but definitely not meant for anyone bigger than a B cup!

I loved this midi dress! It was extremely comfortable and lightweight, perfect for summer. I wore it out at night and during the day and it fit either occasion. I found it looks best with a dressier sandal, rather than with booties. When I first wore the dress, I didn't realize that the straps tied at the shoulder (lol) -- so I tucked the back straps in and wore it as a halter dress. I finally figured it out and wore as intended in the photo; however, both ways worked and looked cute! The front bottons slightly pulled due to my bust being too wide. I think the size M would fit perfectly on someone who wore a 34; however, even with a 36B it worked well.
arrived with a defect that looked like a stain. wasn't that noticeable but bothered me. Sweater was cute overall.
It is nice to wear to work

I wore this so many times. Great piece alone and for layering.
Loved this top and ended up purchasing it! Super soft and comfy.

This top looked so cute on the model and the pink color oh so feminine. Sadly, the color isn’t what it looks like online and the sleeves make my shoulders look big. It added volume but not in a good way. It’s too bad because I was so looking forward to wearing it.
Versatile- wore lots of times, many different ways!
I have never been able to pull off a ruched sleeve. It just looks weird on me. I also felt like this sweater kept pulling up and showing my tummy, which I did not love.
The puff sleeves added and pale pinky peach color felt cute and feminine. It was a warm, short sleeve shirt. Perfect for winter.

I wore this dress just once! I like the feel and look and style. It was a cute midi. You could kind of see the slip underneath through the dress. The sleeves were a little bit short. I dressed down with high top Vans.
Fun for summer or early fall - wouldn't recommend for this time of year if you live anywhere chilly!
Beautiful, simple and feminine. Wore to work and also on the weekends. Paired with white Chealsea booties for a more trendy look. I almost bought it.
Weird fit, not flattering at all.

So in love with this dress! Love the print...can be dressed up or down and feel you could wear this through many seasons! Loved the length on me, fit like a midi...so might not be the best if you are more petite. Neck was a bit tight but not enough to bother me. Love this!
This dress is a perfect transitional piece. Looks great with boots or flats, under a coat or on its own. Beautiful fit and I received tons of compliments. LOVE!
I loved this piece. I was worried it would be a little too Little House on the Prairie, so I styled it with sneakers and a stocking cap. I felt comfortable and stylish.
It was cute. I wore it for Thanksgiving and it was comfortable.
I couldn’t even think of a fun title for this review. It is an okay dress. I wore it once with a belt and once with a vest. I was comfortable all day and I received a couple of compliments.
This dress was meh, I never even wore it. The material was thin and looked cheap to me.
I loved this dress! It is definitely meant to be oversized which is my style. Is was very comfortable and I received a ton of compliments.

links_reviews_title: American Girl Doll But Make It Fashion
links_reviews_text: The colors and pattern of this dress are perfect for fall, and especially perfect for Thanksgiving celebrations (hello, enough room for seconds). Styled it both belted and unbelted and loved it both ways, also looked great with a blazer or cardigan layered over it. Shoe wise I wore it will tall boots but also a heeled loafer, so definitely versatile but looks best with some extra height!
this dress is very flattering and I got lots of compliments. I almost bought it.

links_reviews_title: Easy and perfect transition season dress
links_reviews_text: This dress was effortless in the best possible way. I wore it to a conference in New York with tights and boots and a week later in LA in 80 degree weather with strappy sandals. I received so many compliments. You have to rent this piece. It is so versatile. I am typically a medium and this dress ran true to size.
Loved this flowy dress - such a cute dress for fall! I paired with tan booties and was so comfortable all day!

Yup fully loved this. It flattered my figure and fit in perfectly with my fall transition. I wore this so many times I lost count. It did come with a tear in the underlining layer, but I was able to safety pin it and no one could notice. This is a light dress but it doesn't hug or sit on you at all. It's really the perfect day to night dress.
I should have ordered a small, the Medium was too big at the top and could have been a bit more fitted. Weill order a small next time.

links_reviews_title: Great quality, but not great on my figure
links_reviews_text: The print of this dress is gorgeous, and the skirt has a really great swing to it. Unfortunately, this dress hung weirdly on me, which I probably should've anticipated. I wore it with a fall jacket and ankle boots, which helped break it up, but when I took the jacket off I felt pretty boxy in it.
I felt really pretty in this dress - I belted it around the waist and threw a leather jacket on top with mules.
Loved this dress - very versatile - can dress up with a pretty heeled sandal or down with sneakers, boots or flats. Just skims the body. Great for early fall days when the sun is still warm.
Loved but too “fall” for the time when I ordered it. Looking forward to ordering again when the weather is cooler

Love. This. Dress. It's the perfect summer/fall transition piece, and you can dress it up or down. I had no problem with the fit and sizing, but I always 1) wore it with a belt for definition, and 2) paired it with booties because I'm pretty short. The only thing is that the slip was a little annoying to adjust since it's attached to the dress.

This dress was super comfortable and perfect for fall. I’m pretty petite without curves so it wasn’t really flattering since it’s definitely meant to be loose and boho style. I paired it with a jean and a leather jacket though which broke it up and made me feel less like I was wearing a bag!

I really loved this dress! Makes you look like a modern/chic country peasant. The only reason I did 4 stars was because I had to keep adjusting the neck because it would ride up and start choking me. I belted it at the waist to give myself a shape but if you are thin and straight shaped I think you would do just fine.
Love this dress!!! It’s beautiful and chic and lightweight and lovely. Have dressed it up with sandals and down with sneakers. It’s a stand out piece and I don’t want to give it back!
Loved this as soon as I out it on! Fits true to size and is a wonderful transition piece as we head into the fall season. Wore with a wrap sandal and booties either way looked great!
It wasn't very flattering on me personally, its sheer so there is an inner slip but its very low. Something about the neckline, and everything being so long and loose-fitting wasn't very flattering
This dress is everything!! I am so obsessed! I’ll definitely buy it if it goes on sale! It’s true to size, very flowy and feminine.
Loved the quality of this top! The material is heavy and the fit is flattering. I loved the tie on the side it made it easy to style.
Looks great on model but a bit too boxy and unflattering. Kept trying on but sadly wasn’t as into it as I wanted to be.
The bottons are too high so that the wrap does not fall at your natural waistline. Could not wear as it just did not fit right.
I ordered a medium and should have gotten a small. Would be cute for work or casual weekend wear but it was too bulky and large.

This was the only item in my Nuuly that I was super disappointed with. The material of this top is extremely, extremely thick. It felt more like a sweater than a top, which is confusing and very deceptive. It was also HUGE on me, and I normally always wear size S. I had to return this one without wearing it, but hey, maybe it'll work better in the winter on someone a little taller.

Looks really cute in the stock photo but didn’t in person the fit was kind of weird and was hard to get the side bow to look good. Im a 34c so in case went with a medium instead of a small... might look better on less busty gals.
This was super cute! I wore it to work a couple of times. The fabric is a little bit sheer and it's perfect for spring~
I liked the style of this shirt and it fit well, but the color is nothing like the picture. What I got was a light cream color, almost white. Not at all like I expected but still a nice top.
I wanted this to work, unfortunately it was too shear and essentially see through. The color is so light and more pink than lavender.
Loved this top, although a bit thin for current temperatures and had to wear something underneath because it’s sheer. The color is also lighter than pictured.

links_reviews_title: This was not purple, it was a cream color!!
links_reviews_text: This really surprised me, it was not purple or lavender. It was totally cream! Very deceivng, seeing I chose it for it's beautiful color in the photo. It fit well and I liked the sleaves, looked good tucked into high waisted pants.
I wore this with high-waisted skinny jeans to work. To keep it work-appropriate, I added a tank top underneath because it was a tad see-through. The sleeves are fun, and it's a good color for winter.
also, still too hot for sweaters in LA
Great color and style but very small
Love the fabric, love the puff sleeve, love the color! Perfect top!

links_reviews_title: It is soft and pretty but ...
links_reviews_text: This shirt is soft and pretty but doesn't fit like a large. It is more like a crop top in length and is tight around the waist. Also, the color isn't even remotely similar in the picture as the one I received. The picture is a pretty blush color and the one I received was a washed out greyish pink color.
Shoulders were a little bit funny fitting and roomy in this shirt but still worth keeping and easy to wear out And about
It's ok

links_reviews_title: Kind of boring but also very comfy?
links_reviews_text: This shirt was a bit of a sleeper hit, like why rent a plain long sleeve tee? But it actually was super soft and loved the cropped cut and flattering scoop neck. The color runs a little more lavender/pale mauve in person.

I didn't end up wearing this out because I wasn't convinced from trying it on that it would stay on my shoulders. It was fitted through the chest and waist, but too scooped up top. Cute color, so it's a bit of a bummer!
Love this top and enjoyed wearing it with high-waisted pants. I especially like the cut of the straps which are flattering and hide bra straps well. The length was also just right.
I liked the soft fabric but this piece was waaaay too small and revealing. Would be a nice lounge bra.
This was a great shirt. Perfect crop length. Soft fabric. I just didn’t think it was worth the money. It is really just your basic tank.
the description says crop top, but the pictures make it look longer. It is definitely way shorter than it looks in the pictures!

Cute top that I paired with white crop wide legs, with high waisted jeans, cognac cargo shorts, and under some denim overalls. It literally went with everything. I like the square neck but it showed the tops of most of my bras. I just stopped wearing a bra. I'd probably buy it if it were more reasonably priced. I will probably rent it again though.
These were not flattering, and a weird mix between being tight/pulling on the crotch, and falling off the shoulders. Maybe just not for my body type, but I never wore.
I wanted to love it because it’s SO CUTE but the straps fall down constantly and it bothered me literally the whole time i was wearing it.

links_reviews_title: AMAZING piece - but too small for a very true Medium
links_reviews_text: I wish I ordered a size up, because this is very cute and the material is forgiving, just not in the length where it gives me a phat wedgie :-( if top was adjustable, would not be an issue. Will likely order again in a L bc of how much I like it.
I love this piece, it’s would be so flattering, but it was simply too tight around the waist. I have a larger ‘behind’ so that might be why :) but I could hardly zip it up. Wish they fit! So cute.

I worried about the fit after reading reviews, but the xs fit like a glove (I'm a true xsp). Straps stayed up, didn't ride in the crotch, and was SUPER flattering for the booty. Received compliments all night, from men and women alike. This is a really fun retro style and possibly my first Nuuly purchase.

This jumpsuit is SO cute but as the reviews say, it runs very small - I sized up to a Medium even though I am a textbook size 4 and would typically wear a Small and it fit like a Small Petite. I could get it on, but it looked pretty ridiculous and I definitely could not have sat down in it without some damage to my lady parts! I am 5'7" for reference.
This fit perfect and was really fun to wear. I wore it over a graphic t with a bright colored bootie on one day and the next time with a printed turtleneck and white sneakers!
I’m obsessed with this jumper! It fit like an absolute glove! I truly felt like a rockstar wearing this! So many complements. Definitely on the re-rent or even buy list!
This jumpsuit is very cute, but the fit wasn't ideal for me. The bottom part fit me nicely, but the straps on the top were too big and kept falling on my arms, I had to keep adjusting them all day.
I am tall, but usually wear a small. Ordered in a medium and still could not wear as it was not long enough in torso. Trying again in size large, but I may just be too tall for this jumpsuit.
I loved getting to have this little number for the month- although it ran a little small, I felt really good!

Loved this jumpsuit! It was a littttle tight in my normal size but not to the point that I couldn't wear it. Wore this with a cream turtle neck and booties - it had a cute boho/apres ski feel if that's possible? Would definitely rent again!
Fun and super flattering. I sized down because I read reviews that the straps fell off a lot and it fit, but was definitely more of a standing only situation.

The length of the suspenders were long and would fall off my shoulders but the rise also gave a camel toe effect. I still wore 2-3 times but found the fit to be a little strange. It was very cute in and received compliments when I wore it.
This look is so freakin cute. It was a little tight on me and gave me a big ol' wedgie but hey i looked adorable!

links_reviews_title: So cute and so many compliments!
links_reviews_text: Super cute! Definitely runs pretty small but you want it to be tight because it looks hot that way!!

Wore this with a pink turtleneck and loved it! I’m 5ft 95 lbs and it fit me perfectly. Yes the crotch was tight by a centimeter and the shoulders liked to slip in certain positions but overall I would not size up for my body type. I was just feeling blessed that the length was spot on which is rare for small ladies! My boyfriend and my coworkers also loved it !

links_reviews_title: Beautiful color but snug with an awkward fit
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love this but it was super tight around the midsection and backside. Although I wore it out once, I was very self conscience about the fit. The straps kept falling as well which made it functionally difficult to wear. The color was great, more blue than grey but feminine and versatile.

I loved these overalls. They fit wonderfully, except that I would size up if I tried them again or bought them because they really rode up and can cause a camel toe situation. I got the same size that I wear in pants, so I'd suggest going one size up so you don't run into the same situation.
I’m 5’4 and the torso section was just an inch too short feeling. I didn’t get to wear it because of that but it’s was cute.
Tried to wear but strap kept falling off on on one shoulder and a A little snug in the crotch area!

This is a super cute jumpsuit but it didn't fit unfortunately. I don't have a long torso or anything but I am 5'9 and the size small barely fit over my shoulders and caused a major wedgie. I think this jumpsuit would work well on someone shorter than 5'4. Also recommend to size up.
Loved, but it was tight overall.

Dang, I was really looking forward to this, but it was not made for tall girls. I'm 5'8 and not only was it super tight in the hips, as soon as I pulled the straps up, it went straight up my hooha. I'd only try this is you're below 5'5.
Otherwise super cute. Hard to figure out what shirt to wear with these.

I'm a 00 p, but sized up like all the reviews suggested to a size S and the straps on the torso ended up being too big for me (slipping down). Too bad as the butt and waist fit perfectly. I plan to try it again in an XS as I love the retro style for work, a weekend, or a night out.
I loved the style of this but just felt like it looked weird on me. I think you need curves through the waist to pull this off and I'm pretty straight. Made me look short and boxy.

I recommend ordering these one size larger than you would typically wear. I have a normal sized torso, not very long but these pants were riding up the entire time and were quite uncomfortable for that reason. All other areas of the pants fit relatively well, however, and they looked super cute on.

Super cute! Got lots of compliments. Fit was a little funny... A subtle cameltoe was happening. 😬 I have an average length torso, so if you have a short torso it might fit better. But nonetheless it was adorable!

links_reviews_title: Super cute! Wish I could have worn it.
links_reviews_text: This was short in the torso. Rode up a little bit. And was too tight to tuck a t shirt in to.
Admittedly, I probably should have waited to snag a M, but wanted to test the S. It “fit”, but it was a squeeze. I also have a longer torso so it was a bit short in the body.

links_reviews_title: Got lots of compliments on this jumpsuit!
links_reviews_text: The reviews said that the jumpsuit ran small so I ordered it in a medium (I usually wear small) but it was too loose for me! I still wore it twice, but if it fit better I would have worn it more often since I loved how it looked and received lots of compliments on it. It was just a hassle when the straps kept falling off of my shoulders and I had to wear it with heeled shoes so the pants wouldn't drag on the floor.

links_reviews_title: Wish it fit - extremely cute jumpsuit
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love this jumpsuit - but it just wasn't made for tall people. At 5'10", I got the large and unfortunately it still wasn't long enough for me.. definitely recommend buying this if you are short

when it arrived, the button on the waist popped off as i unzipped it. this was a really cool piece, but fit pretty tight on the waist, the button went back on but as soon as i put the piece on it fell back off within a couple of minutes. super bummer cause it was a really cool jumpsuit.
LOVE the fit on the bottom. I've got a short torso though so it didn't work for my top half.

links_reviews_title: I’m sure I would have worn it a lot if I rented the right size. I am 5’ 5, sz 28 but needed a Lg. Great quality but didn’t fit so never wore it.
links_reviews_text: See above.

LOVE this piece. Fit like a dream with the exception of the top being just slightly too long for me. The waist and length were perfect fir for me at 5'3". Got tons of compliments and may even buy. Super fun.

LOVE these overalls. They fit me well in the hips and waist and made me feel skinny and stylin'. The straps did keep falling off - and that was annoying, but I still like the overalls a lot. Maybe some double stick tape on the straps next time I wear them? I had a little trouble styling them. I ended up wearing them with a black sleeveless rock t-shirt. I am contemplating buying them. Really like them.
Super bummed out that I got this in an XS - it’s waaaay too tight in the crotch. Might rent again in a size up!
Loved it so much I rented again this month. Always a fun outfit

Wore this twice and got compliments both times! I loved everything about this jumpsuit, but didn't want to buy because of the price, however I'll definitely try to rent it again at some point. It's more of a blue-gray in person than it looks in the picture, which I thought was a pleasant surprise. I'm smaller through the chest and waist with larger hips and thighs, and the medium fit my body type perfectly. Only minor downfall was that the straps were a little long for me and cant be adjusted, but it wasn't too bad.

Really love this piece - wore it without a shirt for date night and with a shirt for work (though sans shirt probs only an option if you have a smaller chest). The waist is snug and great detail - I got tons of compliments, recommend!

links_reviews_title: Not good if you aren’t completely proportional
links_reviews_text: I loved this jumpsuit, but I’m smaller on top than on bottom. The jumpsuit fit perfectly on bottom but was way to big on the top. I wore it with a baggy shirt so it worked out, but the straps falling down got annoying

This is an awesome jumpsuit. Unique style and great color and fabric seems durable, but HELLO crotch. I do have a long torso, but it isn't anything out of this world. This jumpsuit was unfortunately unwearable due to riding up in the crotch. There's no way I could've even made it work and been comfortable. I wish it did because other than that, it is great.
Absolutely loved! Ran small like reviews suggest. So size up. It’s perfect length for short girls.

I was so excited to try this romper, but unfortunately was not able to wear it. I'm 5'11" and ordered a size L but the straps would not even fit over my shoulders and the crotch was... shall we say... riding UP. The images say the model is 5'10" and wearing a small?! Hmmm...

links_reviews_title: Cute, not great for Pear shapes
links_reviews_text: As a pear, it fit well on the bottom but was looser on the top. It looked cute if I kept on adjusting it, and if I was standing but was otherwise loose on top. Very cute if you're an apple. Nice quality
wore this with a white tee underneath and loved it. Got a ton of compliments. Super comfortable. Could have probably worn a small but happy with the fit regardless.

links_reviews_title: So cute, looks stylish with outfits but very snug
links_reviews_text: I wore it with a cute black and white striped shirt underneath, but I couldn't get through the full day in the outfit because the sizing was not right for me. The jumpsuit ran really short in the torso for me, and the crotch did not fit comfortably. Also, the straps were long on me and kept falling down. If this fit well it would be the cutest piece- but not meant for me.

links_reviews_title: SO cute but runs EXTREMELY small. XS is definitely made for someone who is a 0 maybe even 00 .
links_reviews_text: Would like cute with a casual shirt underneath, but again the XS just did not fit me.
Snug fit overall
These are sooo cute, the quality is very good! I just couldn't get them to go over my thighs. Which made me very sad. I was SO looking forward to wearing them!
(Not rented for me, rented for my smaller friend, and they didn't fit her)
Love everything about these! Will rent again in a smaller size since they were a little big.

These jeans were great. I wore them several times and got lots of compliments. They were a little long so I always wore w/ boots so they would not drag on the ground. I would totally rent these again.

links_reviews_title: Feel Like A Rock Star in These Jeans
links_reviews_text: This is my 2nd time renting these jeans, I paired with a peasant shirt. I may have to buy this time. If you are into the 60's or 70's vibe, these will make you feel like a million bucks. :)

I loved these jeans so much. They were very thick but had stretch to them. The more I wore them the more comfortable they became. They however are not for short people as I am 5 ' 7' and they dragged the floor even with 3 inch heels.
Ugh!! I had such high hopes for these jeans. They are adorable and super flattering, but way too long for me even in heels :( If you're 5'6" or up, these will definitely work for you!
fit perfectly. highly recommend!
These were adorable but so long - I didn’t have any occasion involving high enough shoes to ever get to wear these beauties.

Granted I am short but even with 6" platforms these were touching the ground. Otherwise though, so cool. Run a teeeny bit big in the waist so if you're between sizes I'd say go down but otherwise stick with your normal.

links_reviews_title: Love the style, but super long
links_reviews_text: Loved the style, super cute. They fit me perfectly throughout but they were about seven inches too long! I'm short but it was comical

I really liked the look of these jeans and they were comfortable with a nice stretch. However, they were so long. I’m 5’6” and I was only able to wear them one night with a good 4 inch heel. Would’ve loved them if they were shorter.
I loved these jeans. So cute and fit really well! They are pretty long so wouldn’t recommend for shorter legs.

These jeans run large like the reviews suggest. I got a size down & they fit me perfectly at the hips. I loved these jeans but they were extremely long to the point where they were basically impossible to wear. I'm 5'5 and it's rare that a pair of pants is noticeably long on me but I paired these with my highest heels & I was still stepping on the ends. They need to be hemmed or the average person could never wear them! Super disappointing.

links_reviews_title: Got so many compliments on these jeans !
links_reviews_text: These are so fun and different from the generic bell bottoms out there right now. I wore them for Halloween and for a college football game and loved the style. I am 5'9 and had to wear pretty tall wedges with them so the jeans didn't hit the floor. worked really well for me, but keep this in mind if you have short legs. Perfect rental from nuuly, loved and now onto the next cute thing! :)

Cool vibes but the sizing was a bummer. The flare was much wider than I was expecting and I'm no prude to a flare. Also, as others mentioned definitely size down as they were large in the waist and length.
The cut of these jeans are flattering and I love the color patches. They are super long though so even with 4” boots, they were dragging.

Sad I couldn’t wear these. I usually have length problems but I often cuff the bottom. Unfortunately you couldn’t do that with these jeans. There is an unfinished hem and very wide bellbottom, so a cuffed hen would just roll right out. I wanted them to work, but just couldn’t get it to look good.

links_reviews_title: order a size smaller than you are!
links_reviews_text: Love these jeans! Order a size smaller than you are! They stretch and are way too long. You can only wear them with heals. I’m 5’7 and they were too long for me. But I still wore them because that are so comfortable and super cute.
Love these jeans! They are so cute and so vintage looking. I would say size down an inch--they are a bit stretchy and I had a bit of gapping in the waist.
This skirt is the perfect length and size for me (I'm 5'2''). I love the way the ruffly parts look in person. Very flattering and cute!
Loved it! Perfect summer piece. Lots of color to play off of and would be a great staple for summer days.

I wore this skirt to work and out on the weekends and I got a lot of compliments both times. The waist fit, but wasn’t super tight so I could tuck t-shirts in easily. I would’ve bought this if it was a little less expensive!

links_reviews_title: Wish it had an elastic waist
links_reviews_text: Ran too large around the waist so it kind of hung at my hips and didn't work. I found it a little too wide/too much material overall.

Love the flowiness of this skirt and how it can be paired in many ways. One thing to take into account is that it's SUPER see-through. I wore it in cold weather with leggings underneath but beware if you don't. The floral print would probably make it less obvious but just FYI.

This skirt was my favorite item in my box. I’ve worn it 3 times already! I wore it with sneakers, a sweater, and a leather jacket for a casual Saturday, and then wore it with a black silk top to an event. I wore it in the chilly northeast and brought it on vacation to Florida with me. It fits a little loose around the waist, but I think could be easily pinned.
Such a pretty, comfortable skirt! Like all Free People, runs a bit big...but that's the style. So many colors, many styling options.

links_reviews_title: Very soft and flowy, a bit short
links_reviews_text: Really cute, just wish it was a bit longer.. it hit at my ankles and was a bit awkward. Very flowy and very soft.

The skirt is so much fun, not something I would typically wear, and my six-year-old daughter thought it was amazing with all the ruffles. I could have sized down though as the 4 was a little big around the waist. I actually wore it three times, more than I thought I would!
This was one I wanted to keep! So flowy and soft cotton fabric. Felt great on.
Great piece. Exactly what it looks like. Perhaps size down if you want a bit less length.
Loved this flowy skirt and paired it with a simple tucked in black shirt for a holiday party where i got lots of compliments.
The cut and fabric gives this skirt such a light fluttery magic. Lovely
This skirt made me feel cute and flirty all night! The ruffles give it such a pretty look when you’re walking and the colors against the black are vibrant.

this isn't something i would typically wear at all, but i wanted to step outside the box with my Nuuly. i LOVED this. Got so many compliments on it. It VERGED on being too long on me, I definitely had to wear heels. Like reviews said, it also runs pretty huge. I'm typically a 2-4 at the waist and I got a 0 and even that was big on me. it seems well made and flutters when you walk. Really lovely.
The skirt is so beautiful it moves really nicely when you walk and it’s fun and flirty! Deff great for the spring and for the winter with a sweater!

Love, love, loved this skirt. I recommend sizing down a bit as it runs a little large in the waist- I wore a belt. I wish I could post a video because the movement of this skirt really makes it extra fabulous. I got a TON of compliments.
So cute and very elegant. Worked for work with heels and a blouse, but could also be dressed down for a weekend casual look with sneakers and a t shirt. Would definitely rent again.
This skirt is so beautiful with its print and how it flows! However, it was really loose in the waist.
This skirt is so cute! I got so many compliments on it!! I styled it with a black bodysuit for dinner with the girls!
Don’t usually wear maxi skirts but boy was this one perfect! Ruffles and florals and the best design! Fit perfect and I’m curvy! very impressed. Would 1000% recommend.

The color of this top is amazing. But it is very sheer so you have to wear a tank top under it. For me, that is really uncomfortable! Way too much fabric. It just hung awkwardly on me, I am not sure if it is because I needed a petite, or what it was, but it just didn’t quite fit right.
Such a great bright happy colors. Super easy to wear tucked in or untucked yes it’s shear but I’m a hairstylist so I can wear it with just a bra it’s not revealing at all. I really love it.
I wish I had the opportunity to wear this. It hasn't been warm enough in NYC. Very flattering with jeans.

Loved this top so much I decided to buy it. It definitely runs on the larger side because it’s meant to be flowy and romantic, I tucked it into a pair of high waisted jeans and it looked great! Such a pretty print and I love that it has a bit of texture.
I got so many compliments on this too whenever I wore it! See through for sure but easy fix and a super light material!!

Really loved this blouse - wore it to work and received many compliments. It is a bit sheer, so you need to wear a cami under it. The only downfall was the sleeves...I found the sinching on the cuffs to be too tight/annoying. Despite that, it's worth purchasing...maybe next time.

I loved this top. It's very beautiful, the quality is great and it made me feel good. I wore it 3 times and would definitely rent it again. I was surprised that it wasn't "too" sheer- you could get away with wearing a bra under it without it looking trashy. This is one of those versatile tops that would be great for work, dates, going out, etc.!

I really, really love this blouse. It's loose without being frumpy. It is definitely sheer, but I wore it with a tank top and it was fine. The color is even richer in person. The neck buttons all the way up, so you could wear it with more of a Victorian flare if interested.

I got lots of compliments on this shirt from my coworkers via Zoom, and I liked wearing it myself! It did feel a little on the cheap side, and does need a cami underneath (not included) but I liked the easy silhouette and pretty pattern.
