The silver detailing on the sleeves was a nice, subtle style point and the texture of the shirt was soft and comfortable. I never wore the shirt, however, because it was so large. I usually size down in free people tops, but I should have sized down at least two sizes. This shirt swallowed me!

links_reviews_title: Comfy and cute, not super flattering
links_reviews_text: It was really big for an XS - but still worked because I got to wear with maternity jeans. Did lay quite as nicely as on model and is more of a sweatery knit fabric.
I rent these Free People tops in varying colors every month. Absolutely love them. They do run very large, so now I just rent a small and it fits much better.

This blouse runs incredibly large and would require tucking in unless you’re super tall. The material was also surprisingly heavy. I tried it on, but couldn’t wear it since I’ve been wearing maternity pants during pregnancy and wouldn’t have been able to tuck in the blouse.
This was cute and casual, however just way too long. I am petite so wore it around with leggings but it was pretty baggy. Even too long to tuck into jeans

This is one of those cool, effortless shirts you can throw on and look put together. I found myself reaching for it often and got compliments, too. Great cut. Definitely very oversized - in S and sometimes M, and an XS worked well for me. Light weight enough to wear on warmer days, too.
LOVE LOVE LOVE the Valley Buttondown! I was considering buying it, I loved it SO much. The color is beautiful, the fit is extremely flattering, and it goes with every outfit.
Love this shirt, kinda wish I had bought it. Very cool vibe, easy to wear loose, or tucked in. Runs large, but I was good with my regular size. Has a slight texture, which added to the look.
I liked the color and oversized look a lot. I only wore it once with black jeans and it was a comfortable look.
Great everyday shirt. Needed to be tucked it.

I chose this piece at the end since i did not know what else to add, but I ended up getting a lot of use out of it! Wore it more unbuttoned with a bralette to go out, or more buttoned with faux leather leggings. It didn't work great tucked in like the photo shows since it is a lot of fabric and long.
I've ordered this twice already because I love it so much and end up wearing it so often! So soft and comfy. It can be worn so many different ways!

wore this LOADS! For work, for drinks, going out, tucked in, untucked, with jeans, with slacks, buttoned up, unbuttoned! Only way I didn't wear it was looped up at the bottom, just didn't work for me. A surprising workhorse!

I tried a large but could have probably sized down, it's very roomy. Soft and flowy, I paired it with leggings or jeans and was always comfortable wearing it for the day. An easy piece to throw on or dress up.
Very nice to wear with jeans to work.

links_reviews_title: Little bit big but liked it
links_reviews_text: Liked it but a little big
This top was the best go to top for any occasion. Fits big but is suppose to and feels great on!
It is huge.. but I made it work.. it was cute for the few times I wore it but wish I was a bit smaller.. for a xs it was like I got a xl
This is cute but super oversized and not my fav piece
I liked the oversize look of this shirt, and the bottom button detail was a cool feature as well. I wore this shirt quite a lot, and it was comfy without looking sloppy!

links_reviews_title: One of my Nuuly staples - but SIZE DOWN multiple sizes!
links_reviews_text: Love love love ordering the Valley Buttondown from Nuuly. This is my second color and this time I finally got the sizing right - I usually order a L or XL in shirts/sweaters but I got a S and it is the perfect size! This is such an easy breezy top to dress down with jeans or tuck in the front to a skirt.

It actually looked fairly cute once paired with jeans and layering necklaces, but at first it looked a bit pajama-top on me. Definitely size down. it I realized I’m not much of a button up top person. Just not really my style.
You can tuck it in and it’s super cute and flattering. I prob should’ve bought it.

i wore this top for 2 days straight after getting it. I wore it to work with jeans, sweatpants after work and then with leggings the whole next day and i got compliments on every look. it is super comfy and super stylish. i'm confused by the price point but thank god nuuly hooked us up with a discount

links_reviews_title: Was so big even with an XS
links_reviews_text: Beautiful color just way to big

This top runs large. Like, really, really large. Like, so large I recommend sizing down TWO sizes if you want to wear it as a top (and not a dress or tunic). Lots of fun details and the color is gorgeous, though. I’ll get my use out of it this month, but I doubt I’ll miss it much when I return it.

links_reviews_title: Perfect cute, cozy top for anything!
links_reviews_text: This was the perfect flowy top that I wore to work/lounging around/running errands. It is realy soft and I loved the texture of it too!
This guy is oversized and sooo soft and cozy. 5 STARS!

Don't be deceived by the model's photo where this blouse looks dreamy and floaty. It is actually a really thick, gauze-like material, and it has a sort of pirate look to it. That being said, I liked it enough to wear it once, and I did receive a compliment on it. But I don't see revisiting this piece in my wardrobe. The material feels like high quality, and there's some cute metal details on the sleeves. But it's really easy to miss all that detail because this top is SO oversized. I'm a girl who likes comfy and oversized, but this was overdoing it, even for me. The material is so thick that I don't see the top tucking in very well either.
Cozy shirt for Winter but it is like a tent! I am a size 10 and I could fit another person in the small with me! Should have gone for XS which is kinda crazy sizing ....

This top's style is definitely meant to be oversized, they were out of the XS and I ordered the small and am 5'4 115ish and it was long but still totally wearable. A lot of fabric to tuck in all around, but I sometimes would tuck in the front or the back for a more polished look. I loved this top and it was easy to style with anything. Good fabric too.
Loved it and bought it. Size down one size.

Super cute and it was perfect for hosting my friendsgiving. It's not supposed to be a form fitting top at all, it's supposed to hang off of you. If you want it to be a little more snug, go down a couple sizes.

I really like this top! It's great for throwing on for errands or dressing up a bit tucked into skinny jeans and some booties or heels. It is very oversize and the bottom does this like crisscross button thing I didn't notice in pictures. You have to unbutton to tuck into pants which causes even more fabric to tuck in, but overall very cute!

I love this black shirt - I wore at least 5 times in one month. It's so comfortable and cute. It's not as low cut as the picture looks so I got away with wearing to work no problem. a bit long in the back but loved to wear it tucked in the front.
This top is a great relaxed and comfortable fit. It runs VERY big so it feels a little frumpy. It’s perfect with leggings for a more casual look.
Order XS. The Medium fit like a XXL.

I loved this button down! The color and material were perfect and I wore it tucked into dress pants for work and tucked into jeans for a night out. The only problem I had was it was a little too over-sized. I'm usually a S/M and I ordered a Small, however, I should've ordered an X-Small. Overall, it was a great piece!
Ran a bit large but wore it more like a tunic top, color is really pretty.
I've worn this shirt out at night, running errands during the day, and to work! So many different ways to style it and SO comfy. I sized down and it's still pretty big, but I love an oversized fit.
Love this top. Paired it with dark skinny jeans and red booties for a pop of color. It’s soft, intentionally oversized and perfect for a casual look

links_reviews_title: Cute and oversized but heavy material
links_reviews_text: The heavy material made it make more sense to wear as an open cardigan or chambray or top layer rather than a shirt

links_reviews_title: Easy to wear and very soft
links_reviews_text: I liked this top it was easy to wear and comfortable. I didn't realize when I ordered it that the bottom was crossed and buttons into place. I think you could wear buttoned up normally if you preferred. It seemed to run a little big, I'm usually a small in FP and could have went with an xs.
Love the oversized fit of this shirt. Wasn't sure about the studs initially but really liked them after I wore it.
Loved the feel and fit of this button up!

As other reviewers have said, this is an oversized blouse but I actually loved the fit. It looks great with skinny jeans - partially tucked it or out. It is SUPER soft and so comfy - I wore it both to work and on weekends and got tons of compliments.
This is a comfy top that you can dress up for work or down with some vegan leather leggings. I wore it when I was feeling like “omg I ate so much yesterday” and still felt cute.

I'm usually a size L, but here I definitely needed the S. It runs super big, but its perfect for work, going out, dinner, throwing something on to run to the grocery store, everything. So obsessed that I bought it.
LOVE this top. I was still able to get some wear out of it BUT it runs insanely big. I ordered a small but should’ve ordered an xtra small.

I was really disappointed with this shirt. I usually wear a size L but I sized down because reviews said it ran large. If you are a size large I would probably get a small or even XS. If you are smaller than a large, just don't get it unless you like the super over-sized baggy look.

This is a really comfortable shirt, but don't expect it to look anything like it does on the model. I couldn't figure out for the life of me how they styled it that way - the shirt has a sort of wrap/crossover in the front and it's just a very confusing style. Was great to toss on one day when I was really exhausted for work but not much more than that - bummer!
love this style but it is just too big, it is hard to style without it looking a little frumpy on me.
too big for me, wish i would have gotten another size
As most FP products, this shirt runs large but I got my regular FP size and it was good! It's an unexpected soft cotton material but that made me like it even more.

This is perfect for wearing over leggings on a casual day. As others mentioned, the fabric is quite thick-- similar to a henley weight. Very nice for the fall. I sized down to an xs and would recommend going one or two sizes down from your normal size. It's still very oversized, but in a fun way!
Loved this shirt. It was so soft. It did run HUGE, but that's standard for Free People. I could've done an XS instead of a Medium. Definitely recommend for everyday wear.

It is truly amazing to me that the model was able to get this shirt tucked into a pair of pants without it looking crazy. Maybe all my jeans are too tight. This wasn't quite what I was expecting, especially how heavy the fabric was. In the few minutes I wore the shirt to try it with different pants, I was sweating heavily by the end. Not ideal for the heatwave we've been having in L.A. I didn't love it, but I didn't hate it. It just wasn't for me. Note that I think it's "true to size" because it's meant to be oversized, but it's HELLA oversized.

links_reviews_title: It's pretty but reads more causal in person than it does in the picture/ on the model.
links_reviews_text: Glad I ordered a small as it's a big boxy top and I would have drown in the medium or large. It's pretty but reads more causal in person than it does in the picture/ on the model.
It runs large but I like the oversized look. The fabric is so comfortable and very easy to wear.

links_reviews_title: Great top, but heavier fabric and slightly different than appears in photo
links_reviews_text: I only got to wear this once as the fall weather hadn’t quite settled in yet. The material is heavier And the shirt has much more fabric than appears in the photo. I am pregnant so didn’t try to tuck it in, but I think it would be difficult to tuck. The shirt actually snaps to a faux wrap at the bottom which is not seen in the photo. It was still very cute and fit well with my baby bump at 22-26 weeks pregnant. I added the plaid one to my next nuuly box so I can try this style again as it cools down. This is definitely looser fitting than on the model. I ordered an XS which is my pre pregnancy size, and still had room to grow. I’m 5’4 and currently about 130lbs. Pre-pregnancy (108 lbs) the XS would likely be too big for me.

This shirt is so soft and comfortable. The fabric is thick and good quality. I wore with white flare jeans and another time with black jeans and booties. It's a quick easy outfit to put together for work or casual weekend plans.
Great casual button down with jeans, great piece for fall
This top was great because it was easy to throw on over some leggings and then put on a cute jacket or boot and your good to go. My only qualm was that i was a little on the big side.
Beautiful shirt with great details but super thick material and ran oversized.
Definitely size down. I'm a small and ordered a small and this was very big on me. I wore it tucked into jean shorts for a casual dinner and it worked well. Comfy and great quality
This shirt is super cute and can be worn a few different ways. Very comfortable but also chic. I got tons of compliments! I loved it so much that I bought it!
Soft and easy to wear but runs REALLY big. I'm a FP small (medium elsewhere) and felt like this was still pretty big. But great color!

Such a versatile, effortless top. You can use the buttons to make it more work appropriate or more revealing. Fabric is thick and hangs well. Only caveat is there's a LOT of (thick) fabric to tuck in if you plan on wearing it like the model. Runs very large; I ordered and XS and it fit like a large.
Super soft very comfy. Very oversized.

links_reviews_title: Really cute and oversized button down
links_reviews_text: I wore it down and tucked in. It was super cute and easy to wear but my only qualm is that it is reALLY BIG so it's hard to tuck in the back.
The shirt was oversized and had lots of fabric. It was hard to tuck in to jeans like how it looks in the picture. Recommend sizing down. I got a small and could have done an XS

This shirt is fine, nothing special. I ordered a size small and it was huge. I wore it twice just because I felt like I had to but it definitely runs large. Maybe it's supposed to look over sized but it felt almost uncomfortably big.

Oversize fit could swallow a short person, so size down. I wore this untucked with leggings and skinny jeans. The top is surprisingly warm. One of the days I wore this was a scorcher and I was happy to be inside an over-air-conditioned office.The fabric snags easily--the only reason I didn't buy this top.
Loved the top, and it was super comfy, but I typically run med/large - and probably would have needed an XS for this to fit me properly.
Its a loose top by style, but was still really loose

Great color, but couldn't wear because there was so much fabric! I usually wear m/l tops, ordered a small and this shirt was so large! tried tucking it in but was too much fabric to tuck...recommend sizing waaaay on down

Cute top, well made. Went down a size because FP. Part of the issue with this one was the weather; it didn’t get cool enough for me to wear it. But it wasn’t super flattering, and I didn’t love the cut of it.

This is such a beautiful top! There are so many hidden details that were a fun discovery along the way. I got a large, as I am usually at least that size but this piece was huge! Felt a little sloppy but I made it work. It was a thicker fabric than I expected so it would be a nice early fall top. It also had an interesting hem detail that was super cool!
Freaking adorable!!!! Loved this top so much. Fabric felt very substantial and the relaxed fit feels so effortless. Definitely can size down, but would be ok if you ordered your normal size as well.
Really liked this top. Really versatile. A great length

this was a very classic example of sizing all the way down for a baggy free people item but it was still just way too frumpy looking. looks much more casual on the model. maybe some people would like the style though.

Listen everyone will say this runs big but just like every other FP item its what you expect . I am a full tiny girl ,I'm 160 but fairly petite if that makes sense . I put this shirt on and was like Yasss this shirt is on point its short in the front long in the back hides the mid section I am not mad at it . It is warm so everyone knows ...

links_reviews_title: Wished I would of wore it more
links_reviews_text: Loved it, styled it with black bell bottom pants and a hat. Size small was perf-a medium would of been way too big-Def a long tunic type fit. Wish I would of wore it more-will rent again!
I got this as a maternity top and it worked great. I’m normally a size S and thought it might be snug but it was way big. Definitely size down, especially if you’re not pregnant
I tried this on, but it wasn't flattering. Much longer and looser than expected, plus it wasn't really my style so I never wore it out of the house.
Cute piece but toooo long for me. I don't know how tall the model is in the pictures, I am 5'4'' and this top came down to mid-thigh, not very flattering at all. Did not wear at all.

As other reviewers noted, this tunic runs large. I’m usually a large and found the medium fit well. It was great with leggings and over the knee boots for a casual look. Comfy material though I thought a tank top was needed underneath since there was small gaps around the front buttons.
This is definitely a tunic!

links_reviews_title: Wanted to love this, but in real life it didn’t match the model pics
links_reviews_text: This is very much my style, but the fit was HUGE. It was super long, and it has a hi-low cut that isn’t really pictured on the product page.
This was my top pick for the month but when I put it on I drowned in it! I’m 5’5” and it looked like a dress on me. also heads up - it’s a little sheer.

I had a different experience with this top than the rest of the reviewers. I thought it was super flattering. It was fitted toward the top and loose and flowy by my waist where I need it. I wore this several times and am going to buy it. Just be sure to order a smaller size. I am normally a large but ordered a small and it fit perfect. I had no issues with the holes or see-through-ness of the top :)
I wanted to like this, it’s really cute! However if you’re petite it’s not flattering at all, it’s super long in the back. I probably should have gone with an xs!
This top is gigantic. It also has a ton of open weave so that it really can't be worn as a top.
Very comfortable and it had a nice weight and length but it was very large and kept almost slipping off my shoulders.
This top is definitely cute, but didn't really work for me.

I couldn’t tell from the pictures that this top has a collar and, for whatever reason, it seemed to ruin the casual, throw-on affect of the top. The collar combined with the ruffles was just too much.

links_reviews_title: Very cute and comfortable top. It was a little warm for the summer. It would be great to wear in the fall!
links_reviews_text: I paired it with a white tank, leggins and heels.

This was not what I expected. The fit is way too large. It looks totally different on the model. I’ll have to wear it with a tank on underneath. It’s also a heavier fabric than I thought it would be. Better for winter.

links_reviews_title: Hard to get on and off
links_reviews_text: I like a jumpsuit but if you can't take it off and on easily to use the loo, it's trouble. The problem is the front placket. It doesn't unbutton low enough so it's really tight to get on and off. It's cute and flowy but it's impractical. I wanted to love this, but I didn't.
This is just a fun jumpsuit. Fits great and felt like pajamas! These are the kind of items I love to rent because they are unique and fun to wear once or twice and then get something new!

links_reviews_title: Not a fit for my height
links_reviews_text: There’s a lot I like about this jumpsuit, but the problem for me was the waist. The tie is secured to The back jumpsuit and can’t be adjusted without pulling in odd places and revealing a change of direction in the striped pattern.
I got lots of compliments but it was difficult to get in and out of.

links_reviews_title: Kacey Musgraves wishes she owns this jumpsuit
links_reviews_text: Very fun and cute - you're bound to get compliments on this. TTS and comfortable.
The fit and materials were nice on this but the colors made it feel like a clown suit. Never ended up wearing it.
Didn't look flattering on a petite woman like myself.

links_reviews_title: Very cute jumpsuit, but not ideal for petites
links_reviews_text: I’m a 5’2” lady and this jumpsuit was cutting it close for me. It fit quite baggy and folded at my feet. I got a lot of compliments wearing it but would have had to gotten it tailored to truly feel good in it.

Literally felt like I was wearing pajamas to work! The fabric is a little on the lighter side, definitely meant for the warmer days. Also, a bit transparent on the lighter colors, which happened to fall on my butt!

links_reviews_title: Super Cute but Weird Fit For a Tall Gal!
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to love the jumpsuit, and everyone's reviews/pictures seemed great, but this did NOT fit me at all. I believe I ordered the correct size, but it was very short in the torso, and the tie (which is fixed in the back so you can't adjust) was in a weird place on me. Also, because of the fit, with just those buttons in front, it was very difficult to get in an out of. I'm 5'9" but I've got a pretty short torso compared to my long legs. The legs were long enough, the torso definitely too short.

I absolutely LOVED this romper. As the other reviewers said, it really is great for shorter people. I am 5' 3" and 150lb and this fit me perfectly. It was perfect for work or a night out and was very easy to dress up or down depending on the shoes and accessories. It is a pretty thin material so I would suggest wearing tights underneath if you are wearing it in the colder months.
Loved this jumper so much! It was flattering even for someone a little shorter like myself. The colors were amazing and it was SO comfy.

I liked this jumpsuit, but I didn’t LOVE it. The arms were a bit short (came closer to my elbow than wrist) and the length of the legs was also a touch too short. Sizing up would have made it a little too baggy. Overall, it was comfy and the color was super playful and fun, but the fit could be better!

links_reviews_title: You should size up for a better fit
links_reviews_text: I ordered a M which needs to be either really true to size or run a little big. This did not. I would have preferred it to be a bit looser. But wore it anyway. Also, a bit sheet so was careful about the undergarments. The colors are lovely, the length is a perfect for me at 5'3" so if you're tall this is going to be cropped on you.
Tried this one on. The torso was so short it was unwearable for me. I own other jumpsuits in this brand so I was expecting more. Would work for petites.

links_reviews_title: Showstopper with the Feel of Silk Pajamas
links_reviews_text: I can't tell you how many compliments I received when I wore this jumpsuit. Truly, people went out of their way to tell me how much they liked it. I loved that it felt like wearing silk pajamas all day, and yet I could dress it up for a fun evening on the town.

Absolutely loved this jumpsuit. I sized up for a looser fit to accommodate larger bust, which made it fit perfect! paired with a strappy heel and received tons of compliments...will definitely order again.
Fits as expected
Another great piece I wouldn't have thought to bought. I like this so much that I purchased!

Loved it, I have a booty and a little leftover mommy bump in the front, so this could have been really unflattering. But it was great, smoothed things out and perfect slit up the side! Was a great option for work and play.

This was so comfortable! I rented it because I saw a girlfriend has rented it from Nuuly and ended up buying it. I styled it first with a oversized knit sweater from nuuly as well. I may have to buy this piece! Fit true to size and had nice stretch so it was very comfortable. Also high waisted which I loved.
Loved this skirt. Perfect with sweaters, crop tips, graphic tees, and tucked in blouses. It’s so soft and comfy and the weight is heavy enough to work well in the Bay Area’s perpetual spring.

links_reviews_title: Loved this dress it up or down skirt
links_reviews_text: Wore it with an oversized sweater and also a regular fitting tee shirt. Loved this and didn't feel out of place wearing it to casual things. Soft velvet but not hot!
Loved this one - easy fit, goes with everything, you can wear it with flats or heels, simple but elegant, great color too. I bought it!

I wore this at least 10 times during my rental period and it's the first Nuuly piece I've kept. It's perfect with hightop converse and a tee shirt or with heels and a blouse. I love how cozy it is and that it looks just as great dressed up as it does dressed down. It's a favorite in my closet and I couldn't love it any more!

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable, for fitting, can dress up or down
links_reviews_text: I wore it for work with a dressy black top that was flowy. I got compliments on it by female and male coworkers. Could also dress it down with a tshirt. Buying it so I can keep it in my wardrobe
Dress this up or down it’s a grate staple piece to have that still has a wow factor bc of the fabric. I wore this a ton and loved it with every recreation

I loved this skirt so much. It was so cute and comfortable and looked very "casually cool" paired with just a black t-shits and some boots and leopard socks. The color was actually a little less red than in the pictures, but I still loved it. Would definitely buy.
Lovely skirt but I should’ve ordered a small. Maybe the elastic band was stretched out from use but it didn’t fit.
Loved how it hugged my curves. Sexy and comfy I kept it!
Loved this skirt! It hugged my curves without making me feel self conscious, paired well with everything and the color was great... I almost had to buy it... might have to rent this one again...
This skirt fit me and one of my friends tried it on because she thought it was cute and it fit her even though we are not the same size!

I loved this skirt so much. The fabric, fit, and color were so nice and the price is very reasonable. The weather is still a little chilly, so I’ll likely wait to purchase in a few months. Love love love! Super flattering and easy to match with all kinds of stuff in my closet.

links_reviews_title: Great fit, but made for tall frames!
links_reviews_text: I loved the color and fabric, but it was way too long for me. The skirt ended up going down to my ankles. Since there was only one slit on the side, when you looked at the skirt from the front it really swallowed me up. If I owned the skirt, it might be worth it to just hem the length. But as a rental, I never wore it out.
Cute skirt but very very large.
I wore this for thanksgiving and was so happy with it! So flattering and comfortable. I ordered a medium and felt like it fit perfect. I’m normally a size 6 pant

links_reviews_title: Great way to dress up a sweatshirt
links_reviews_text: Wore this with a sweatshirt and white platform tennis shoes. Got so many compliments! Great color and texture.

This skirt is perfect for my long-legged friends, hits exactly the right spot and was slimming on my tummy. Perfect amount of stretch, I've dressed it up with a black mock neck and worn with a t-shirt, very cute piece, I am keeping!
Fits so well and is stretchy on the right spots and contouring in the gut area. Honestly probably fits most body types!
I loved this skirt, it was super flattering on me and super comfortable! You can dress it up or down.
Stretchy and comfy and easy to dress up or down.
This is a great skirt. I loved pairing it with t-shirts and heels. It fit well and kept me warm in the chilly weather.
Beautiful, very flattering fit. Super soft. Had to buy it!
I received a ton of compliments on this skirt. Wore it casually with sneakers and a jean jacket and dressed it up for dinner with heels and a sweater. Fits true to size.
Cute and comfy skirt but just not super exciting. Great to pair with a fun patterned top. Ran a little large but still true to size, just keep in mind if you're in between sizes.

Love this skirt! I'm usually a medium, sometimes a large, and the medium fit very well. The length, color, and fabric is great for fall, and the slit shows just enough leg while remaining modest enough to wear at my casual workplace. I dressed it up with a nice blouse and heels but also wore it super casually with a graphic tee and combat boots. Strongly considering purchasing this skirt for good!

Did not expect to love this so much! Great length. The velvety cord fabric feels fresh without being too trendy. Color is true to the images online, w/ very perfect fall vibes. The fit is fitted but comfortable. Looks really good with sneakers!

I read a past review stating that if you’re between sizes to go up. I’d disagree. The fabric is really forgiving and even though I’m between a M/L I feel like I could have even worn the small in this. A medium would’ve worked best. Also for petite girls beware that this will hit you lower than the model! Still going to make this work for the month though

This skirt is a nice addition to any Fall Wardrobe. The cord material makes it Fall ready, but you can pair it with Tee's when it still feels more like Summer in late September. Love the side slit detail

I really wanted to like this one. It is a little clingy in spots I didn't want it to cling to. There's a tiny opening in the back that made it so I couldn't wear it to work because my tattoo would have been exposed. It is a gorgeous little dress and I love the flared at the wrist sleeves. If we weren't in stay-at-home mode, I'm sure I would have found somewhere to wear this.

Got compliments from my husband on this dress but never had the chance to wear it. The fabric was on the warm side but surprisingly forgiving (a plus for my postpartum pooch). I would rent again for an indoor summer event. Fabric is just too thick for any outdoor summer fun.
Looking for a cute dress that is actually comfy, this is it!

links_reviews_title: Good, basic jumpsuit -- but not perfect
links_reviews_text: this is totally decent jumpsuit, enough that I wore it twice this month, but it's definitely not perfect due to fit and fabric. a lot of others have noted that the sizing is generous on this, so I'd fully agree with the advice to size down. and yes, there are some little button-closure tabs at the back/sides that allow you to cinch it in a little bit for waist definition, but on my body cinching like that just resulted in a big airy bulge of loose fabric in the upper back that didn't look great (I threw a jacket on top to hide that both times I wore this). my bigger issue with this jumpsuit, sizing aside, is that the fabric doesn't feel very sturdy or flattering. though the garment fit me fine it was prone to some odd and uneven pulling at some of the middle buttons when I moved around, the buttons themselves were really hard to fit into the holes, and the fabric felt stretched out, wrinkly, and worn as the day so I was feeling pretty disheveled in it by 5pm. I'm obsessed with jumpsuits & the REALLY amazing ones I own are made of fabric that sits more smoothly on the body so as not to have this issue even after a full day of wear.

links_reviews_title: Good, basic jumpsuit -- but not perfect
links_reviews_text: this is totally decent jumpsuit, enough that I wore it twice this month, but it's definitely not perfect due to fit and fabric. a lot of others have noted that the sizing is generous on this, so I'd fully agree with the advice to size down. and yes, there are some little button-closure tabs at the back/sides that allow you to cinch it in a little bit for waist definition, but on my body cinching like that just resulted in a big airy bulge of loose fabric in the upper back that didn't look great (I threw a jacket on top to hide that both times I wore this). my bigger issue with this jumpsuit, sizing aside, is that the fabric doesn't feel very sturdy or flattering. though the garment fit me fine it was prone to some odd and uneven pulling at some of the middle buttons when I moved around, the buttons themselves were really hard to fit into the holes, and the fabric felt stretched out, wrinkly, and worn as the day so I was feeling pretty disheveled in it by 5pm. I'm obsessed with jumpsuits & the REALLY amazing ones I own are made of fabric that sits more smoothly on the body so as not to have this issue even after a full day of wear.
